title: Classic Tennis Stars
description: Serve up your knowledge of tennis legends from the sport's most exciting era, from the 1940s through the 1980s!

questions.question: Which American tennis player won the Grand Slam (all four major titles in one year) in 1953?
Billie Jean King defeated Bobby Riggs in the famous 'Battle of the Sexes' match in what year?
Which Australian tennis great won 11 Grand Slam singles titles in the 1960s, including the calendar Grand Slam in 1962 and 1969?
Which fiery American player was known for his on-court outbursts and the phrase 'You cannot be serious!'?
Chris Evert was famous for her powerful baseline game and which signature shot?
Which Swedish player was known as 'Ice Borg' for his cool demeanor and won five consecutive Wimbledon titles from 1976 to 1980?
Arthur Ashe became the first Black man to win which Grand Slam singles title in 1968?
Martina Navratilova, born in Czechoslovakia, won a record how many Wimbledon singles titles?
Which American player, known as 'Little Mo,' tragically had her career cut short by a horseback riding accident in 1954?
Who was the first Black woman to win a Grand Slam title, taking the French Open in 1956?
The famous 1980 Wimbledon final between Bjorn Borg and John McEnroe featured an epic tiebreaker in which set?
Jimmy Connors was known for playing with what unusual racket material that most players had abandoned?
Which Australian woman won the Grand Slam in 1970, becoming only the second woman to accomplish this feat?
Pancho Gonzales dominated professional tennis in the 1950s. What was his heritage that made him a trailblazer?
The 'Open Era' of tennis, allowing professionals to compete in Grand Slams alongside amateurs, began in what year?
